main_text:
Metaphysics || On Generation and Passing Away
3.8 On Generation and Passing Away

As is standard within the intellectual milieu dominated by
Aristotelian physics, Israeli opined that the generation and passing
away of terrestrial objects was the result of recombination of
elements and their attendant properties (heat, coldness, wetness and
dryness), a process which is governed by the movement of the cosmic
sphere. Later thinkers would, via astrology, attribute certain roles
in this process to the “intelligences” governing
individual celestial objects and their relative positions. The
heavens, which are not composed of the four elements and hence not
affected by their contrary qualities, are not subject to generation
and degeneration. (Isaac Israeli [Book of
Definitions], p. 48)
